definition:
\begin{definition}\label{def1:ps}
a $C^{*}$-algebra $A$ is:\\
\\
$\bullet$ a linear associative (in general noncommutative) algebra over the field $\mathbb{C}$ ;\\
\\
$\bullet$ a Banach algebra, that is a normed space such that:\\
\[\Vert a\Vert\geq 0~;~~\Vert a \Vert=0~~iff~~a=0,~~\forall~a\in A\]
\[\Vert \lambda a\Vert=\vert\lambda\vert\Vert a\Vert,~~\forall~\lambda \in \mathbb{C}\]
\[\Vert a+b\Vert\leq \Vert a\Vert+\Vert b\Vert~~~\forall a,b\in A\]
\[\Vert a\circ b\Vert\leq \Vert a\Vert\Vert b\Vert,~~\forall~a,b\in A\]
The last requirement tells us that the product $\circ$ in the algebra is continuous (clearly $A$ is a complete space with respect to the topology defined by the norm) ;\\
\\
$\bullet$ a $^{*}-$algebra, i.e. there exists an antilinear $^{*}$ operation
\[^{*}:A\longrightarrow A\]
such  that
\[(a+b)^{*}=a^{*}+b^{*};~~(\lambda a)^{*}=\overline{\lambda}a^{*};~~(ab)^{*}=b^{*}a^{*}\]
with the involutionary property
\[a^{**}=(a^{*})^{*}=a,~~\forall~a\in A\]
$\bullet$ it satisfies the $C^{*}$ condition:
\[\Vert a^{*}a\Vert=\Vert a \Vert^{2}\]
\

\begin{definition} given a Banach algebra $A$ and $a\in A$, the spectral radius $\Vert a\Vert_{sp}$ is defined as follows:
\[\Vert a\Vert_{sp}:= sup\left\{\vert \lambda \vert ~s.t.~ \lambda\in Spectr(a)\right\}\]
\
